fields.label: Protocol Version
fields.helper: The Protocol version. The current value is '1'. This will only change when there are changes made that are not backwards compatible.

fields.label: Tracking ID / Web Property ID
fields.helper: The tracking ID / web property ID. The format is UA-XXXX-Y. All collected data is associated by this ID.

fields.label: Anonymize IP
fields.helper: When present, the IP address of the sender will be anonymized. For example, the IP will be anonymized if any of the following parameters are present in the payload: &aip=, &aip=0, or &aip=1

fields.label: Queue Time
fields.helper: Used to collect offline / latent hits. The value represents the time delta (in milliseconds) between when the hit being reported occurred and the time the hit was sent. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. Values greater than four hours may lead to hits not being processed.

fields.label: Cache Buster
fields.helper: Used to send a random number in GET requests to ensure browsers and proxies don't cache hits. It should be sent as the final parameter of the request since we've seen some 3rd party internet filtering software add additional parameters to HTTP requests incorrectly. This value is not used in reporting.

fields.label: Client ID
fields.helper: This anonymously identifies a particular user, device, or browser instance. For the web, this is generally stored as a first-party cookie with a two-year expiration. For mobile apps, this is randomly generated for each particular instance of an application install. The value of this field should be a random UUID (version 4) as described in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt

fields.label: User ID
fields.helper: This is intended to be a known identifier for a user/visitor provided by the site owner/tracking library user. It may not itself be PII. The value should never be persisted in GA cookies or other Analytics provided storage.

fields.label: Session Control
fields.helper: Used to control the session duration. A value of 'start' forces a new session to start with this hit and 'end' forces the current session to end with this hit. All other values are ignored.

fields.label: IP Override
fields.helper: The IP address of the user. This should be a valid IP address. It will always be anonymized just as though &aip (anonymize IP) had been used.

fields.label: User Agent Override
fields.helper: The User Agent of the browser. Note that Google has libraries to identify real user agents. Hand crafting your own agent could break at any time.

fields.label: Document Referrer
fields.helper: Specifies which referral source brought traffic to a website. This value is also used to compute the traffic source. The format of this value is a URL.

fields.label: Campaign Name
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign name.

fields.label: Campaign Source
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign source.

fields.label: Campaign Medium
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign medium.

fields.label: Campaign Keyword
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign keyword.

fields.label: Campaign Content
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign content.

fields.label: Campaign ID
fields.helper: Specifies the campaign ID.

fields.label: Google AdWords ID
fields.helper: Specifies the Google AdWords Id.

fields.label: Google Display Ads ID
fields.helper: Specifies the Google Display Ads Id.

fields.label: Screen Resolution
fields.helper: Specifies the screen resolution.

fields.label: Viewport size
fields.helper: Specifies the viewable area of the browser / device.

fields.label: Document Encoding
fields.helper: Specifies the character set used to encode the page / document.

fields.label: Screen Colors
fields.helper: Specifies the screen color depth.

fields.label: User Language
fields.helper: Specifies the language.

fields.label: Java Enabled
fields.helper: Specifies whether Java was enabled.

fields.label: Flash Version
fields.helper: Specifies the flash version.

fields.label: Hit type
fields.helper: The type of hit. Must be one of 'pageview', 'appview', 'event', 'transaction', 'item', 'social', 'exception', 'timing'.

fields.label: Non-Interaction Hit
fields.helper: Specifies that a hit be considered non-interactive.

fields.label: Document location URL
fields.helper: Use this parameter to send the full URL (document location) of the page on which content resides. You can use the &dh and &dp parameters to override the hostname and path + query portions of the document location, accordingly. The JavaScript clients determine this parameter using the concatenation of the document.location.origin + document.location.pathname + document.location.search browser parameters. Be sure to remove any user authentication or other private information from the URL if present.

fields.label: Document Host Name
fields.helper: Specifies the hostname from which content was hosted.

fields.label: Document Path
fields.helper: The path portion of the page URL. Should begin with '/'.

fields.label: Document Title
fields.helper: The title of the page / document.

fields.label: Content Description
fields.helper: If not specified, this will default to the unique URL of the page by either using the &dl parameter as-is or assembling it from &dh and &dp. App tracking makes use of this for the 'Screen Name' of the appview hit.

fields.label: Link ID
fields.helper: The ID of a clicked DOM element, used to disambiguate multiple links to the same URL in In-Page Analytics reports when Enhanced Link Attribution is enabled for the property.

fields.label: Application Name
fields.helper: Specifies the application name. Only visible in app views (profiles).

fields.label: Application Version
fields.helper: Specifies the application version. Only visible in app views (profiles).

fields.label: Event Category
fields.helper: Specifies the event category. Must not be empty.

fields.label: Event Action
fields.helper: Specifies the event action.  Must not be empty.

fields.label: Event Label
fields.helper: Specifies the event label.

fields.label: Event Value
fields.helper: Specifies the event value. Values must be non-negative.

fields.label: Transaction ID
fields.helper: A unique identifier for the transaction. This value should be the same for both the Transaction hit and Items hits associated to the particular transaction.

fields.label: Transaction Affiliation
fields.helper: Specifies the affiliation or store name.

fields.label: Transaction Revenue
fields.helper: Specifies the total revenue associated with the transaction. This value should include any shipping or tax costs.

fields.label: Transaction Shipping
fields.helper: Specifies the total shipping cost of the transaction.

fields.label: Transaction Tax
fields.helper: Specifies the total tax of the transaction.

fields.label: Item Name
fields.helper: Specifies the item name.

fields.label: Item Price
fields.helper: Specifies the price for a single item / unit.

fields.label: Item Quantity
fields.helper: Specifies the number of items purchased.

fields.label: Item Code
fields.helper: Specifies the SKU or item code.

fields.label: Item Category
fields.helper: Specifies the category that the item belongs to.

fields.label: Currency Code
fields.helper: When present indicates the local currency for all transaction currency values. Value should be a valid ISO 4217 currency code.

fields.label: Social Network
fields.helper: Specifies the social network, for example Facebook or Google Plus.

fields.label: Social Action
fields.helper: Specifies the social interaction action. For example on Google Plus when a user clicks the +1 button, the social action is 'plus'.

fields.label: Social Action Target
fields.helper: Specifies the target of a social interaction. This value is typically a URL but can be any text.

fields.label: User timing category
fields.helper: Specifies the user timing category.

fields.label: User timing variable name
fields.helper: Specifies the user timing variable.

fields.label: User timing time
fields.helper: Specifies the user timing value. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: User timing label
fields.helper: Specifies the user timing label.

fields.label: Page Load Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took for a page to load. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: DNS Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took to do a DNS lookup.The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: Page Download Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took for the page to be downloaded. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: Redirect Response Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took for any redirects to happen. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: TCP Connect Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took for a TCP connection to be made. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: Server Response Time
fields.helper: Specifies the time it took for the server to respond after the connect time. The value is in milliseconds.

fields.label: Exception Description
fields.helper: Specifies the description of an exception.

fields.label: Is Exception Fatal?
fields.helper: Specifies whether the exception was fatal.

fields.label: Custom Dimension
fields.helper: Each custom dimension has an associated index. There is a maximum of 20 custom dimensions (200 for Premium accounts). The name suffix must be a positive integer between 1 and 200, inclusive.

fields.label: Custom Metric
fields.helper: Each custom metric has an associated index. There is a maximum of 20 custom metrics (200 for Premium accounts). The name suffix must be a positive integer between 1 and 200, inclusive.

fields.label: Experiment ID
fields.helper: This parameter specifies that this visitor has been exposed to an experiment with the given ID. It should be sent in conjunction with the Experiment Variant parameter.

fields.label: Experiment Variant
fields.helper: This parameter specifies that this visitor has been exposed to a particular variation of an experiment. It should be sent in conjunction with the Experiment ID parameter.
